**Drying Mushrooms: A Quick Guide**  
Want to preserve your foraged mushrooms? Start by slicing them thinly and laying them out on a clean, single layer on a baking sheet. Dry in a warm, dry place (like a dehydrator or oven on the lowest setting with the door slightly open) until completely crisp—this can take 6–12 hours. Store in airtight containers once fully dry. Never dry or eat mushrooms you can’t confidently identify.
